channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 7 dead, at least 30 missing in Myanmar after boat carrying people who fled fighting capsized
item.description: Seven confirmed dead and over 30 missing after an overcrowded boat, carrying villagers fleeing from Myanmar conflict, capsized in the Andaman Sea. The boat, intended for 30-40 passengers, was overloaded with 70-75 people and commodities, sinking near Kyauk Kar. Heavy currents and overcrowding are suspected causes.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces new sexual assault lawsuits amid growing allegations
item.description: Rapper Sean "Diddy" Combs faces five new civil lawsuits, accusing him of sexual assault and rape from 2000 to 2022. Plaintiffs include two men and three women, with one woman alleging assault at age 13. Combs is already detained on federal racketeering and sex trafficking charges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan PM Sharif advices President Zardari to sign 26th Constitutional Amendment Bill into law
Orionid meteor shower: When and where to watch the celestial event's peak
item.description: The Orionid meteor shower, linked to Halley's Comet, peaks from Sunday night into Monday morning with up to 20 meteors per hour. Best viewing is post-midnight, with visibility improved by the waning hunter's moon. The event remains active until November 22.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Hurricane Oscar brings heavy rainfall and winds to eastern Cuba after landfall
item.description: Hurricane Oscar made landfall in eastern Cuba, bringing heavy rainfall, strong winds, and flooding before weakening to a tropical storm. The storm, initially a Category 1 hurricane, prompted warnings of significant flash flooding and mudslides. Cuba is already grappling with its worst blackout in two years, complicating recovery efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not your punching ball': France protest in solidarity with mass rape victim Gisèle Pelicot
item.description: Hundreds gathered in Paris and other French cities to support Gisèle Pelicot, whose ex-husband is on trial for drugging and allowing over 50 men to rape her for more than a decade. Her public handling of the case has sparked widespread debate on sexual abuse and the justice system's leniency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Modern bathrooms, cash & more: Glimpse into Yahya Sinwar's secret bunker
Four, including a child, killed in as Helicopter crashes into cell tower in Houston: All you need to know
item.description: A helicopter crash in Houston claimed four lives, including a child. The private R44 collided with a radio tower, resulting in a fire. The incident occurred near Engelke Street and North Ennis Street. Authorities are investigating, and the victims' identities remain undisclosed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Naim Qassem? Hezbollah leader who allegedly fled to Tehran amid fear of assassination
item.description: Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary-General, Naim Qassem, has taken refuge in Tehran after fleeing Lebanon due to fears of assassination by Israel. Qassem departed Beirut on October 5 on an Iranian aircraft. Following Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death, Qassem has delivered speeches from both Beirut and Tehran. Israel continues to target Hezbollah leaders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Lights so bright, can only see black ones': Harris' campaign shares clip of Trump's controversial speech
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign reposted a clip of Donald Trump's February 24 speech in Columbia, South Carolina, which drew criticism for its perceived racial insensitivity. Trump remarked he could only see Black people in the audience. Social media exploded with backlash, though some defended Trump, arguing the comment was humorous. Trump's history of controversial statements on race adds context.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If baby can survive outside womb then ...': Elon Musk shares his stance on abortion ban
item.description: Elon Musk, while supporting Donald Trump, states that abortion is murder if a baby can survive outside the womb, highlighting the complexity of the issue. He criticizes education for instilling fear in young girls about motherhood, emphasizing that having children can bring unparalleled joy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Don't respect them as soldiers': Trump responds to being called 'most dangerous person ever'
item.description: Former US President Trump responds to criticism from retired General Jim Mattis and General Mark Milley, who describe him as a threat to the nation. Trump dismisses them as 'woke' and 'not great generals,' criticizing Milley's advice on Afghanistan and questioning their leadership abilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump puts on Apron, works at McDonald's drive-through in latest viral video
item.description: Donald Trump ran a fry station at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, challenging Kamala Harris's college job claims. Wearing an apron, he prepared fries while jabbing at Harris's story. He held an impromptu press conference from the drive-thru, making headlines as Election Day approaches. Trump praised the workers but skirted questions on minimum wage policies.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Panda rentals come with strings attached: 5 things China expects
item.description: Panda agreements between American zoos and the China Wildlife Conservation Association are tightly controlled, with zoos agreeing to limit communication about panda health and finances, pay for Chinese experts' trips, restrict live feeds, and face potential contract termination for unauthorized disclosures.

item.title: Dollar-starved Maldives notifies new foreign currency rules
Brazil's President Lula cancels Russia trip for Brics summit following head injury
item.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva canceled his trip to the Brics summit due to a head injury sustained from a fall. Advised against long flights, he will participate via videoconference. Foreign Minister Mauro Vieira will lead Brazil's delegation in his place.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Poor choice of approaches ... ': Arnold Palmer's daughter reacts to Trump's unexpected tribute to golf legend
item.description: Arnold Palmer's daughter found Donald Trump's tribute to her father inappropriate but wasn't upset. She mentioned her father's affinity for golf and belief in the Republican Party. Trump's tribute at a Latrobe rally included a controversial anecdote. Patrick Wears will vote in the upcoming election as an unaffiliated voter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Missing crew members found dead after fighter jet crash in Washington state
item.description: Two US Navy aviators were found dead after their EA-18G Growler jet crashed near Mount Rainier during a training flight. Search teams, including a Navy helicopter and Army Special Forces, located the wreckage in a remote, densely wooded area. The Navy has transitioned to a salvage operation and is investigating the cause of the crash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Worked 15 minutes more than Kamala ... ' Trump visits McDonald's in Philadelphia; works the frier
item.description: Former President Donald Trump visited a McDonald's in Philadelphia, where he mocked Vice President Kamala Harris's claim of working at the chain during college. Trump aimed to connect with blue-collar voters, drawing support outside while Democrats protested across the street.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia shooting: One killed, multiple injured in Albany State University
item.description: A shooting at Albany State University in Georgia during a homecoming week concert left one person dead and six injured. The incident occurred around 8:50 pm on East campus. The Georgia Bureau of Investigation is leading the probe. The identities of the victims remain undisclosed, but a 19-year-old from Atlanta has died.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
